title: Update the FA Filings Report to use a new multiplier
custom_steps: The FA Filings report when run for predicted filings needs to be updated to give players service days based on a multiplier.  The multiplier is calculated using the two new system values entered in [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-423|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-423|smart-link] and is: original days in season / actual days in season.This multiplier should then be applied when predicting the players end of season service days.  The total season days should be rounded to the nearest integer (less than .5 round down, .5 and greater round up)Service example:  multiplier = 186 / 100 = 1.86 after 1 day in season every player receives 2 days of service (1.86).  On day 2, each player has 4 days of service (3.72), on day 3 each player has 6 days of service (5.58), on day 4 each player has 7 days of service (7.44)This report uses its own view and doesn't run through any of the existing calculations to updates to it will be separate from the rest of the service calcs.

title: Update the Super 2 Prediction Report to use a new multiplier
custom_steps: The 2+ Salary Arbitration ‰ÛÏSuper Two‰Û� Eligibility report when run for predicted filings needs to be updated to give players service days based on a multiplier.  The multiplier is calculated using the two new system values entered in [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-423|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-423|smart-link] and is: original days in season / actual days in season.This multiplier should then be applied when predicting the players end of season service days.  The total season days should be rounded to the nearest integer (less than .5 round down, .5 and greater round up)Service example:  multiplier = 186 / 100 = 1.86 after 1 day in season every player receives 2 days of service (1.86).  On day 2, each player has 4 days of service (3.72), on day 3 each player has 6 days of service (5.58), on day 4 each player has 7 days of service (7.44)The actual service calculations have already been modified to handle the modified and the value has been passed through to the calculations, however this must still be tested in order to ensure its fully working.AC:

title: Update the Salary Arb Service Calc to use a new multiplier
custom_steps: The Salary Arbitration Service calculations which run when approving various transactions need to be updated to give players service days based on a multiplier.  The multiplier is calculated using the two new system values entered in [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-423|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-423|smart-link] and is: original days in season / actual days in season.This multiplier should then be applied when predicting the players end of season service days.  The total season days should be rounded to the nearest integer (less than .5 round down, .5 and greater round up)Service example:  multiplier = 186 / 100 = 1.86 after 1 day in season every player receives 2 days of service (1.86).  On day 2, each player has 4 days of service (3.72), on day 3 each player has 6 days of service (5.58), on day 4 each player has 7 days of service (7.44)The actual service calculations have already been modified to handle the modified and the value has been passed through to the salary arb calculations, however this must still be tested in order to ensure its fully working.

title: As a User, I want to see new columns added to the Service Breakdown Widget
custom_steps: Breakdwon widget is located on Service tab of Professional ProfilesWireframe: [https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service|https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service]AC:* The MJ Days column will be updated to display two values** One will be the adjusted count of days rounded to the nearest whole number** The second, appearing in parenthesis, will be the adjusted count of days, round to two decimal places)** If the two values are the same, don‰Ûªt display the number in parenthesisDev Tasks:* Update the SERVICE.ROSTER_BREAKDOWN_FUNC to take in the calculated multiplied value and apply it to the new columns* Update the MLS_PLAYER_BREAKDOWN_VIEW to calculate the multiplier and pass it to the function* Update the MLS_PLAYER_BREAKDOWN_VIEW to include the new columns* Update the widget to include the new value

title: As a User, I want to see new columns added to the Major League Summary widget
custom_steps: Major League Summary tab is located on Service tab of Professional ProfilesWireframe: [https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service|https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service]AC:* The following columns will be updated to also display the adjusted number of days** Days w/ Club** Total Season Service** Total MLS* The adjusted values will appear in parenthesis within the same cell as the non-adjusted values* For years where there is no service multiplier, there will not be a value in parenthesis* Any value that includes the adjusted value in parenthesis will a be a flyover** This flyover will read: ‰ÛÏService has been adjusted for the YYYY season and is prorated using the following formula:  X / Y = Z‰Û�*** X = Original Days in Season system value*** Y = Adjusted Days in Season system value*** Z = Service Multiplier system valueDev Tasks:* Add the adjusted values to the Major League Summary widget on the Player Profile Service.* Update the pro_mj_service table with new columns to count the actual days* Update the service calc to maintain actual days as well as multiplied, multiplied days are rounded to the nearest day* Update the pro_mj_service_all to total up the values for both

title: Update the MJ Service Calc to use a new multiplier
custom_steps: The MJ Service calculation needs to be updated to give players service days based on a multiplier.  The multiplier is calculated using the two new system values entered in [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-423|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-423|smart-link] and is: original days in season / actual days in season.This multiplier should then be applied to the actual number of days the player receives for the season and any rounding will be to the nearest integer (less than .5 round down, .5 and greater round up)Example:  multiplier = 186 / 100 = 1.86 after 1 day in season every player receives 2 days of service (1.86).  On day 2, each player has 4 days of service (3.72), on day 3 each player has 6 days of service (5.58), on day 4 each player has 7 days of service (7.44)

custom_steps: Value:Adding these fields will allow us to change or repurpose existing IL transactions without needing to create new ones.  For example, if the 60 Day IL needs to temporarily function as a 45 Day IL, we could reconfigure the 60 Day settings, rather than create a new 45 Day IL.AC: - Five fields will be added to the db:  -- Minimum Length  -- Recert Length  -- Player Type: Both, Pitchers, Position Players  -- Start Date  -- End Date

title: As a Developer, I want to update the payroll details report to write results to a table and return a report id
custom_steps: The Payroll Details report currently returns a JSON object which the crystal report pulls using CDATA.  We want to replace that with a REST call to generate report results and store them into a table.  The table structure for this should match the current payroll snapshot tables as they store everything that is needed.The REST call should return an ID which the report can use to pull all of the data.

title: INC0146970 - Updated CBT/LRD Cash Accounting For Payroll Reports
custom_steps: Hey Guys-I wanted to flag an item for discussion after we return from arbitration. As more Clubs‰Ûª payrolls have been proximate to the CBT threshold, we would like to revisit the way we account for cash on the Payrolls reports when it is run ‰ÛÏas of‰Û� a certain date. Right now, my understanding is that EBIS has some fairly convoluted back-end logic to calculate the CBT allocations on multi-year cash transactions, and there‰Ûªs not really any way we can update the resulting calculations.What I would like to do, if possible, is apply that same logic to an additional feature on each Outright (Trade) page. What I‰Ûªm envisioning, on the Mookie Betts trade as an example, would be an additional collapsible section titled ‰ÛÏCash Payroll Allocations‰Û� for trades that include cash considerations. This section would have the same back-end logic that EBIS has now, except only BOC users could adjust the yearly allocations. When running payrolls ‰ÛÏas of‰Û� a certain date, the cash would pull from the allocations assigned to each trade page rather than the back-end logic. Basically, it would give us the ability to make manual adjustments to cash, which many Clubs have requested.Let me know if there‰Ûªs a good time in early March to discuss this new feature, and I can put together a more robust description of the desired functionality in the interim.Thanks,Cameron

title: As a Drug Testing User, I want to see values in the Status & Dates section on Drug Test Requests

title: As a BOC AMT User, I want to be notified via email that a Club has failed to upload a Check In Photo
custom_steps: AC:* When a user chooses ‰ÛÏPlayer Not Present‰Û� during check in, to bypass uploading a picture, they have 24 hours to upload a picture* If the User fails to upload a picture by the 24 hour deadline, BOC Users will receive an email notifying them*Subject:* \[Org] Missing Check in Photo*Content:* \[Player Roster First] \[Player Last] was checked in on \[Check In Date] at \[Check In Time] by \[Org] without a photo.  They have failed to upload a photo with in 24 hours and are now unable to do themselves.

title: As an AMT User, I want to be reminded to upload a Check In Photo via email
custom_steps: AC:* When a user chooses ‰ÛÏPlayer Not Present‰Û� during check in, to bypass uploading a picture, they have 24 hours to upload a picture* If that user hasn‰Ûªt uploaded a picture within 12 hours, the system will send a reminder via email*Subject:* Missing Check in Photo*Content:* \[Player Roster First] \[Player Last] was checked in on \[Check In Date] at \[Check In Time] without a photo. You have until \[Deadline Date] at \[Deadline Time] to upload a photo.Please log into AMT to upload one or contact BOC with any questions or concerns.

title: As a user I want the contract language advanced search to return results
custom_steps: Update the contract langauge advanced search to use dbms_lob.instr (or other functions in that package) to improve performance.Example SQL showing usage:select    langdata.LANGUAGE_DATA_IDfrom    LANGUAGE_CUSTOM cust JOIN (select CLAUSE_TYPE_ID from clause_type_lkup where language_level_id = 2) clauseType     on clauseType.CLAUSE_TYPE_ID = cust.CLAUSE_TYPE_IDJoin LANGUAGE_DATA langdata     on cust.LANGUAGE_DATA_ID = langdata.LANGUAGE_DATA_IDwhere    dbms_lob.instr(lower(LANGUAGE_DATA_CLOB_SEARCHABLE),'recoup')>0;

title: INC0145049 - add Salary and ML Base columns to MNC Adv Search export
custom_steps: AC:* When running an advanced search with a type of Minor Contract, Salary and ML Base will be result columns* When exporting these search results, Salary and ML Base will be included as columns in the exportFrom SNOW: I ran this advanced search below and when I export to excel or PDF it does not include the Salary and ML Base column in the export.  Those two columns do not export.

title: INC0120420 - New widget / updated Contract Language widget
custom_steps: Received from: jeff.pfeifer@mlb.comRecipients: ebissupport@mlb.com,Garrett.Horan@mlb.com,gina.liento@mlb.com,rreuter@lbisoftware.com,matthew.salvatore@mlb.comWould like to expand this widget to include the following:-          To be able to return a list of players whose contract (Major or Minor) contained or contains the selected clause.  It was suggested that there be an option next to each clause (a new column) that, when selected, will take the user to the Advance Search with the specific contract clause type filled and the expected results listed.  The column could be labeled (‰ÛÏShow Players‰Û�)-          To add a row to each clause type that has a Club or Custom language version, and to be able to perform the same search described above on that selection as well-          To add Minor League Miscellaneous to the list of options in the Clause type

title: MNC E-sign testing - non-1st year MNC
custom_steps: -E-sign button will be available on MNC in any states where the print button is also available, see: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3784672/MNC+Buttons+by+State|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3784672/MNC+Buttons+by+State|smart-link] -user must have EBIS-MNC-ESIGN individual perm (already added to boc approver in dev, can be added to individual club accounts as needed)-workflow will follow the global e-sign workflow including player signature and club stamping of the MNC(documentation here: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788242/EBIS4-SET-464+Use+Cases)|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788242/EBIS4-SET-464+Use+Cases)]-this should be tested at least once using the e-sign over email function(only once since there are limited licenses for email function)-when issues are found comment the issue below including the MNC URL, also upload the PDF of the MNC with issues to this drive: [https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/folders/1Wcsd9nJ52fzECj80tePXRN18xALypftu|https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/folders/1Wcsd9nJ52fzECj80tePXRN18xALypftu] and reference the document by name in your comment-this ticket should be used to track ALL issues found with non-1st Year MNCs

title: E-Sig improvement for Minor League Players (VR Form)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Place on Voluntarily Retired List Tx is created
custom_steps: WHEN a player receives an invitation to e-sign a Notice of Disposition for "Place on Voluntarily Retired List
custom_expected:
THEN player will have the ability to enter a reason for their retirement
AND Reason will be in teh form of a text box
AND Reason will be a required field in order to E-sig
AND Reason entered will display on document after e-sign process has been completed

title: Add version dropdown to ebis link utility
custom_steps: Ebis link now has multiple versions which the user can query.  In order to simplify querying for them, we will add a version dropdown to the link utility.The dropdown should be right below the Request dropdown and should list all versions for which the end point is available.To handle this, we will need to add an ebis link version table with an assoc table between that and EBIS_LINK_ENDPOINTS_LKUP.  We'll add another procedure call to add a version to each endpoint add add those calls directly below each item in the utilities lookup.sql.The only change in functionality will be to add /v1/ at the front of each link.   The screen should default to version 0 (for now)

title: Player not present checkbox for prospect checkin is randomly placed
custom_steps: Wireframe: https://zpl.io/V0JDDwl

title: As a User, I want to place a Pitcher on the 10-Day IL(NEEDS AC)
Highmark Updates
custom_steps: From Mike Camillone:1)	One issue is that a number of fake SSNs end up getting passed to Highmark.  Since domestic players must have an SSN in their profile in order to sign a Minor League contract, in cases where they don‰Ûªt have an SSN and they need to sign a contract, BB Ops is advising Clubs to put in a dummy SSN in order to move the process along.  This is not good for Highmark as it causes the player‰Ûªs benefits account to be set up incorrectly.  Since international players do not require an SSN in order to sign, EBIS already has logic that will include the player‰Ûªs Player ID in the Highmark file if they don‰Ûªt have an SSN.  We should do this for domestic players who don‰Ûªt have SSNs.  I understand that we shouldn‰Ûªt hold up the Club from signing the contract, so maybe we can add something to the screen in EBIS to allow the Club to specify that they are waiting for the player‰Ûªs SSN; that way, the Club would not enter a fake SSN and the Highmark batch would grab the Player ID instead.*For #1, I‰Ûªm thinking that maybe the easiest thing to do is update the Highmark batch to grab a domestic player‰Ûªs Player ID if he doesn‰Ûªt have an SSN, the same as we do for intl players.*2)	Another issue is with missing addresses for players signing their first Minor League contract.  For domestic players, DPL requires the player to have at least one address, so I would expect that address to come over to his EBIS profile.  But it seems that international players may not have an address in their profile.  An example is Bryan Encarnacion (ID 811708).  When we pass address info from EBIS to Highmark, Highmark uses it to determine which coverage plan to put the player under (US/Dominican/other).  EBIS lets the user type in an address at the time of contract signing (which is what happened with Encarnacion).  Maybe the Highmark batch should also look at this address?  Or maybe this address should be put into the player‰Ûªs profile?*For #2, I‰Ûªm thinking that the Highmark batch should grab the contract address if an address doesn‰Ûªt exist in the player profile.*

title: Add banner text when batches are running
custom_steps: As a BOC user, I want to see a banner on the EBIS website when batches are running. This will allow me to know that now is not a good time to be working on the site. This will let me know that the ebis team is not able to address the issue. We should also use this time to make it so we can put up a banner in other cases as well. Either for information, warnings, or other outages.

title: MnR Bonus Clauses
custom_steps: INC0136415From Cameron:Would like Clubs to be required to fill out data tables for PBs in Minor League UPCs such that the information can be queried from the back-end (similar to Major League UPCs). This change would also be helpful for many internal reporting processes.Questions (Matt/Brian):1.	Are we only going to do this for performance bonuses or for other addendum B clauses as well?  (If more, which ones?) 2.	Are we tracking earned information as well in addition to just the initial values? 3.	Do we want to actually check the performance bonuses against stats or are we leaving that up to users? 4.	We won‰Ûªt be able to convert the existing data, so should we modify the existing contracts to now allow this entry or just leave them as is and let new contracts enter the data? 5.	How do you envision this working in regards to the bonus payment tracking screen?  Is this in addition to that or integrated with it?  For major contracts the tracking info is just in line in the contract.  But some MNC clauses that already have this data (IBP, signing bonus, etc) are already tracked on the bonus payments screen 6.	Do we want to add the bonus payment tracking info into ebis link, exposing at least some of the data requested? Answers (Cam):1)	I think we just need clauses for performance bonuses.2)	No ‰ÛÒ that will be trackable via the MJ UPC.3)	Check in terms of whether or not they‰Ûªre earned? No, we shouldn‰Ûªt have to do that.4)	I think just new contracts is fine for now.5)	I haven‰Ûªt contemplated the Bonus Payment Tracking section, nor has ARI I believe. Can we kick this part down the road for now?6)	Yes, we definitely want this data available via the link!

title: As a User, I want a new Person BAM ID Batch created
custom_steps: AC:* This batch will run nightly* WIll connect to:[http://lookup-service-prod.mlb.com/named.player_id_xref.bam?player_active_sw=%27Y%27&xref_type=%27bis%27|http://lookup-service-prod.mlb.com/named.player_id_xref.bam?player_active_sw=%27Y%27&xref_type=%27bis%27]* It will compare persons in ebis and if BAM ID doesn't match, the BAM ID in ebis will be updated* Shut off the process Dave runs every night once this goes live* Two versions:** One just missing BAM IDs AND on a roster** Full comparison job of current roster players

title: As a User, I only want the Drag and Drop area to be outlined when a file is droppable
custom_preconds: GIVEN user wants to attach file on transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user "drags and drops" one or more files
custom_expected:
THEN file upload area will outline in blue only when file(s) are drop-able
AND if user leaves file upload area without dropping files, area will no longer highlight blue

title: As a User, I want to see a Player Programs Widget on Pro Player Profiles
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on INFO tab of a player
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to Baseball Info section of professional player

* There will be a new Program Participation widget in the baseball info section of professional player profiles
* The new widget will match the provided wire and data discovery
* When the profile is in edit mode, there will be an Add Row button
** Clicking the Add Row button will add a row to the widget
* When rows are present, there will be a trash can icon on each row
** Clicking the trash can icon will delete the row
* There will be a comments bubble on each row that will allow the user to enter comments
* Clicking save on the profile will commit changes
* This story should also handle any necessary data conversion into the new format
** Players with existing Rookie Career Development data entered for them will have it appear correctly in the new widget
** Check how LINK responds to changes
* BOC Profile Admin users should be able to edit this widget
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a new "Program Participation" widget
AND new widget will match the provided wire and data discovery
AND there will be an Add Row button when profile is in edit mode
 ** Clicking button will a row to widget 
AND when rows are present, trash can icon will display on each row

title: INC0121072 - Hard Error for Assignment Clause
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is creating MNC with an Assignment Clause
custom_steps:
WHEN user includes an Assignment Clause in MNC
AND enters a date on Roster Type Requirement on clause prior to 3/15
custom_expected:
THEN system will perform a rule check on submit
AND if value entered is not >= 3/15
THEN system will return a HARD ERROR
AND error message will display: 
"Assignment Clause Roster Date must be between 3/15 and the end of the MJ League Season. Please contact BOC."

title: Push Rule 4 Draft Data to a queue
custom_steps: DPL needs a way to automatically update its data based on what happens in the Rule 4 Draft. We can send a message to an SNS Topic (or the GCP equivalent) to make it consumable by DPL and potentially other consumers. In the future, we may want to explore using more messages, such as when a player signs their contract.
